title: Biden says debt ceiling bill avoids catastrophic economic default
description: President Joe Biden on Friday discussed a bill to lift the debt ceiling, just days before the Treasury estimated the government would run out of money.

title: Elon Musk and Twitter face growing brand safety concerns after execs depart
description: Several high-level Twitter employees tasked with brand safety have left, creating a potentially bigger problem when it comes to policing hate speech.

title: Tech stocks close out first six-week rally since January 2020
description: The Nasdaq Composite rose 2% this week, boosted by a big rally in Tesla and an earnings from software maker MongoDB

title: FDA allows temporary import of unapproved Chinese cancer drug to ease U.S. shortage
description: The FDA has given Qilu Pharmaceutical permission to ship cisplatin to the U.S. to ease a national cancer drug shortage.

title: West Coast ports shut down as union workers 'no show' after breakdown in wage negotiations
description: West Coast ports are shutting down after union workers walked off the job after a failure in negotiations with port management.

title: Why wealthy Americans love UBS, the secretive Swiss banking giant
description: UBS's wealth management division has attracted wealthy foreign clients, due in part to strong Swiss secrecy laws.

title: 93% of CEOs are preparing for a recession—here's what it means for you
description: Economists and business leaders alike see a recession on the horizon, but investors continue to push the stock market upward.

title: Buy Buy Baby draws sale interest in Bed Bath & Beyond bankruptcy, one bidder looks to save stores
description: At least two bidders are looking to purchase Buy Buy Baby amid Bed Bath & Beyond's bankruptcy, including one that wants to keep 75% of stores open.

title: Even as inflation rate subsides, prices may stay higher. Here's why
description: Prices and inflation are still a "top concern" for U.S. consumers, one expert says. For many, the big question is how soon they may see financial relief.

title: Payrolls rose 339,000 in May, much better than expected in resilient labor market
description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 190,000 in May, according to Dow Jones.

title: Consumers are more likely to cut back on restaurant visits than trade down to fight inflation, report says
description: In April, prices for food away from home rose 8.6% compared with the year-earlier period, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Consumers keep traveling despite recession fears and inflation
description: Airline and other travel bookings have been strong, despite concerns about higher interest rates, inflation and an economic slowdown.

title: 'Everyone can see the reality' in Ukraine except for Putin, UK defense minister says
description: British Defense Minister Ben Wallace on Friday said Vladimir Putin is "at risk of losing everything" if Russia does not withdraw its forces from Ukraine.

title: OPEC+ prepares for weekend meeting after Saudi warns speculators to 'watch out'
description: Saudi energy minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman has urged oil market speculators to "watch out."

title: JPMorgan raises 2024 economic outlook for India, but remains cautious of global headwinds
description: JPMorgan marked up its 2024 growth forecast from 5% to 5.5%, citing a number of reasons to justify only a modest increase.

title: When to teach kids about money, according to the experts — and how to do it
description: Knowing when to start teaching to kids about money and identifying what money skills they need can be tricky, but experts say it is crucial for their futures.

title: Chinese EV startup Li Auto says car deliveries more than doubled in May
description: Chinese electric car startup Li Auto said it delivered more than twice as many cars in May versus a year ago.

title: U.S.-China ties weigh on security summit as defense chiefs meet in Singapore
description: Defense chiefs from around the world are due to meet at the annual Shangri-La Dialogue in Singapore this weekend.

title: This couple bootstrapped their way to a multimillion-dollar business. Here are their top tips for success
description: Launched 5 years ago with $220,000, Coco & Eve's co-founders said they are "well on the way" to $100 million in annual revenue.

title: Russian forces target food and water sources to starve Ukrainians, international law report says
description: The new report details routine Russian strikes in concentrated areas where civilians gathered to receive humanitarian aid and food supplies.

title: Meta will require employees to return to the office three days a week starting in September
description: Meta is the latest company to requir employees to work from corporate offices at least three days a week.
